title: 100% FREE AMAZON KDP Keyword Research Step by Step for Beginners [ 7 STEPS ]

tactics.name: keyword_type_analysis
tactics.description: Categorize keywords into head, body, and long-tail based on specificity and search volume
steps: Define head terms as single-word keywords
Identify body keywords as 2-3 word phrases
Recognize long-tail keywords as 4+ word specific phrases
caveats: Head terms may have unclear searcher intent
source_quotes: "Head terms... don't convert to sales very well."

tactics.name: Buyer Persona Creation
tactics.description: Define target audience demographics and pain points to guide keyword selection and product positioning.
steps: Determine interests and product usage scenarios
caveats: Avoid altering keyword order from auto-suggestions
source_quotes: Combine keywords in the most logical order. Customers search for 'military science fiction' but probably not for 'fiction science military'.

tactics.name: alphabetical_variation
tactics.description: Use alphabetical letters appended to keywords to discover low-competition long-tail keywords
steps: Append each letter of the alphabet to keyword phrases
Record new suggestions as long-tail keywords
caveats: Ranking algorithms may change search results over time
source_quotes: Sometimes you may come across long-tail keywords that are not started with your search term.

tactics.name: Amazon Auto-Suggestion Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate keyword viability by analyzing Amazon search results, BSR rankings, and competitor listings to identify low-competition niches.
steps: Check search results for self-published books
Compare BSR rankings and sales data
Prioritize keywords with lower BSR and no sales
caveats: Inaccurate BSR data for new products
source_quotes: If you publish a book with this keyword, you can start your journey from the 1st or 2nd page easily.

tactics.name: Google Keyword Planner Use
tactics.description: Leverage Google Keyword Planner to estimate search volumes and discover non-branded keywords for cross-platform traffic opportunities.
caveats: Google volumes may differ from Amazon data
source_quotes: Google's Keyword Planner is a FREE tool that shows you estimated search volumes for any word or phrase.

heuristics.name: match_type_selection
heuristics.condition: If using broad match, expect broader search result variations
source_quotes: "Broad match... includes plural form and related searches."

heuristics.name: Keyword Order Optimization
heuristics.condition: If keywords are reordered from auto-suggestions, penalize
source_quotes: They give more weight to the 'Exact Match' and 'Phrase Match'. Therefore you should better to put your keywords in your title according to Amazon Auto-Suggestions

heuristics.name: kdp_book_presence
heuristics.condition: If KDP books appear on first page of search results, boost keyword
source_quotes: Check if there are any KDP Self-Published Books on the first pages

heuristics.name: Low-Competition Signal
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has low BSR and no sales data, prioritize it for entry
source_quotes: If you publish a book with this keyword, you can start your journey from the 1st or 2nd page easily.

claims.statement: Keyword research is critical for KDP Low Content Book rankings
source_quotes: "Keyword research strategy is still one of the most important parts..."

claims.statement: Exact match keywords receive higher priority in Amazon's search algorithm than broad match variations.
source_quotes: They give more weight to the 'Exact Match' and 'Phrase Match'

claims.statement: Amazon search results and BSR rankings can change over time
source_quotes: Don't forget that current ranking weight calculations... can be changed tomorrow.

claims.statement: Amazon does not provide keyword search volume data
source_quotes: Amazon doesn't provide any keyword search volume data.

niche_patterns.description: Combine product identity with specific attributes for better conversion
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Reduces competition and improves search relevance
source_quotes: "Body Keywords... more specific than Head Keywords."

niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience needs with precise keyword combinations
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Aligns with customer search intent and physical constraints
source_quotes: James is a 10 year old, fourth grade student who loves basketball. Unfortunately, he lost one of his lined notebooks yesterday in school and needs a new one.

niche_patterns.description: Target specific product variations with limited competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Narrower niches reduce competition while maintaining search volume
source_quotes: Type 'lined notebook 8.5 x 11 120 pages' on the Amazon Search Bar.
